textKnowledge.title: Perfect Knife Skills for Dicing Onions
textKnowledge.description: Master the technique of dicing onions without tears
textKnowledge.content: To dice an onion perfectly: Cut in half from root to tip, peel outer layers, make horizontal cuts toward the root (don't cut through), make vertical cuts following the onion's natural lines, then slice crosswise. The root end holds everything together.

textKnowledge.title: Understanding Mise en Place
textKnowledge.description: The French culinary principle of preparation and organization
textKnowledge.content: Mise en place means 'everything in its place'. Before cooking, measure and prepare all ingredients, arrange tools, and organize your workspace. This professional technique reduces stress, prevents mistakes, and ensures smooth cooking flow.

textKnowledge.title: Proper Pasta Cooking Technique
textKnowledge.description: How to cook pasta to perfect al dente texture
textKnowledge.content: Use 4-6 quarts of water per pound of pasta. Salt generously (1-2 tablespoons). Don't add oil. Stir occasionally. Test 2 minutes before package time. Al dente means slight resistance when bitten. Reserve 1 cup pasta water before draining.

textKnowledge.title: Tempering Spices in Indian Cooking
textKnowledge.description: The art of tadka or tempering whole spices
textKnowledge.content: Heat oil or ghee until shimmering. Add whole spices in order of hardness (cumin seeds, mustard seeds, curry leaves). Listen for sizzle and watch for color change. Pour immediately over dish. This releases essential oils and creates aromatic depth.

textKnowledge.title: Resting Meat After Cooking
textKnowledge.description: Why and how to rest cooked meat properly
textKnowledge.content: After cooking, let meat rest 5-10 minutes (steaks) or 15-30 minutes (roasts). This allows juices to redistribute throughout the meat. Cover loosely with foil. Internal temperature rises 5-10°F during rest. Result: juicier, more flavorful meat.

textKnowledge.title: Balancing Flavors in Asian Cuisine
textKnowledge.description: The five fundamental flavors in Asian cooking
textKnowledge.content: Asian cuisine balances five flavors: sweet (sugar, mirin), sour (vinegar, lime), salty (soy sauce, fish sauce), bitter (greens, tea), and umami (mushrooms, fermented ingredients). Adjust each element to create harmony. Taste and adjust continuously.

quoteKnowledge.title: Julia Child on Cooking Fearlessly
quoteKnowledge.description: Encouragement to embrace mistakes in the kitchen
quoteKnowledge.quoteText: The only time to eat diet food is while you're waiting for the steak to cook.
quoteKnowledge.speaker: Julia Child

quoteKnowledge.title: Auguste Escoffier on Simplicity
quoteKnowledge.description: The master chef's philosophy on refined cooking
quoteKnowledge.quoteText: Good food is the foundation of genuine happiness.
quoteKnowledge.speaker: Auguste Escoffier

quoteKnowledge.title: Marco Pierre White on Perfection
quoteKnowledge.description: Insights on achieving excellence in cooking
quoteKnowledge.quoteText: Perfection is lots of little things done well.
quoteKnowledge.speaker: Marco Pierre White

quoteKnowledge.title: Anthony Bourdain on Passion
quoteKnowledge.description: The late chef's view on cooking with heart
quoteKnowledge.quoteText: Your body is not a temple, it's an amusement park. Enjoy the ride.

quoteKnowledge.title: Massimo Bottura on Innovation
quoteKnowledge.quoteText: Tradition is not about looking back but about moving forward with awareness.
quoteKnowledge.speaker: Massimo Bottura

quoteKnowledge.title: Madhur Jaffrey on Spices
quoteKnowledge.quoteText: Spices are the soul of Indian cooking. They can turn simple ingredients into magic.
quoteKnowledge.speaker: Madhur Jaffrey

recipes.title: Classic Spaghetti Carbonara
recipes.description: Authentic Roman pasta with eggs, cheese, and guanciale

cookingStepList.instruction: Bring large pot of salted water to boil for pasta.
Cut guanciale into small strips and cook in dry pan until crispy, about 8 minutes.
In bowl, whisk egg yolks with grated Pecorino and black pepper.
Cook spaghetti until al dente, reserve 1 cup pasta water.
Add drained pasta to pan with guanciale, remove from heat.
Add egg mixture, toss quickly, adding pasta water to create creamy sauce. Serve immediately.

recipes.title: Chicken Tikka Masala
recipes.description: Creamy tomato-based curry with marinated grilled chicken

cookingStepList.instruction: Marinate chicken pieces in yogurt, half the garam masala, and salt for 30 minutes.
Grill or broil marinated chicken until charred and cooked through, about 12 minutes.
Heat oil, sauté diced onions until golden, add ginger-garlic paste.
Add tomato puree and remaining garam masala, cook for 10 minutes.
Add grilled chicken pieces and cream, simmer for 15 minutes.
Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve with naan or rice.
Remove steaks from refrigerator 45 minutes before cooking, pat dry.
Season both sides generously with salt and pepper.
Heat cast iron skillet until smoking hot, add oil.
Sear steaks 4-5 minutes per side for medium-rare.
Add butter, garlic, and thyme; baste steaks for 2 minutes.
Remove from heat, rest 10 minutes before slicing.

recipes.title: Authentic Pad Thai
recipes.description: Classic Thai stir-fried rice noodles with shrimp

cookingStepList.instruction: Soak rice noodles in warm water for 20 minutes, drain.
Mix tamarind paste, fish sauce, and palm sugar for sauce.
Heat wok over high heat, scramble eggs, set aside.
Stir-fry shrimp until pink, add noodles and sauce.
Toss everything together, add eggs and bean sprouts.
Serve with crushed peanuts, lime wedges, and chili flakes.

recipes.title: Classic Margherita Pizza
recipes.description: Traditional Neapolitan pizza with fresh mozzarella and basil

cookingStepList.instruction: Mix flour, yeast, water, oil, and salt; knead for 10 minutes.
Let dough rise in covered bowl for 90 minutes until doubled.
Divide into 4 balls, rest 15 minutes.
Preheat oven to maximum temperature (500°F/260°C).
Stretch dough, top with crushed tomatoes, torn mozzarella.
Bake 8-10 minutes until crust is charred, add fresh basil.

recipes.title: Beef Bourguignon
recipes.description: Classic French beef stew braised in red wine

cookingStepList.instruction: Cut beef into 2-inch cubes, season with salt and pepper.
Brown bacon in Dutch oven, remove. Brown beef in batches.
Sauté diced carrots and onions, add tomato paste.
Return beef, add wine, stock, and bay leaves.
Cover and braise in 325°F oven for 2.5 hours.
Sauté mushrooms separately, add to stew before serving.

recipes.title: Vegetable Biryani
recipes.description: Aromatic layered rice dish with spiced vegetables

cookingStepList.instruction: Soak rice for 30 minutes, parboil with whole spices until 70% cooked.
Fry sliced onions until golden brown and crispy.
Cook vegetables with biryani masala and yogurt.
Layer rice and vegetables in heavy-bottomed pot.
Top with fried onions, saffron milk, mint, and ghee.
Cover tightly, cook on low heat for 20 minutes (dum method).

recipes.title: Molten Chocolate Lava Cake
recipes.description: Decadent individual chocolate cakes with gooey center

cookingStepList.instruction: Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C). Butter and flour 4 ramekins.
Melt chocolate and butter together in double boiler.
Whisk eggs, yolks, sugar, and vanilla until thick and pale.
Fold melted chocolate into egg mixture, then fold in flour.
Divide batter among ramekins, filling 3/4 full.
Bake 12-14 minutes until edges are firm but center jiggles. Serve immediately.

recipes.title: Classic Caesar Salad
recipes.description: Traditional Caesar with homemade dressing and croutons

cookingStepList.instruction: Toast bread cubes with olive oil until golden for croutons.
Mince garlic and anchovies into paste using mortar and pestle.
Whisk egg yolks, lemon juice, mustard, and anchovy-garlic paste.
Slowly drizzle olive oil while whisking to emulsify dressing.
Toss torn romaine with dressing until evenly coated.
Top with croutons and shaved Parmesan, serve immediately.

recipes.title: Artisan Sourdough Bread
recipes.description: Naturally leavened bread with crispy crust and tangy flavor

cookingStepList.instruction: Mix flour, water, and starter. Autolyse for 30 minutes.
Add salt, perform stretch and fold every 30 minutes for 3 hours.
Bulk ferment at room temperature for 8-12 hours until doubled.
Shape into round loaf, place in proofing basket seam-side up.
Cold proof in refrigerator for 12-18 hours.
Score top, bake in preheated Dutch oven at 450°F for 45 minutes.
